tool.name: AnisotropicFilter

param.name: niter
param.dialogReference: The number of passes the filter will make. Higher values correspond to coarser smoothing of non-edge pixels.

param.name: estimate_k
param.dialogReference: Determines whether K values will be estimated according to the method described in [C. Tsiotsios, M. Petrou "On the choice of the parameters for anisotropic diffusion in image processing, Pattern Recognition" (2012), http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.patcog.2012.11.012], or provided by the user. Estimation of K values is recommended for more accurate smoothing, but can be skipped if appropriate K values are already known.

param.name: k
param.dialogReference:
The edge preserving threshold (minimum slope to define an edge).

Only used if estimate_k is False. K defines the threshold for both vertical and horizontal slope directions when a k2 value is not provided. K defines only the threshold for the vertical direction when a k2 value is provided.

param.name: k2
param.dialogReference:
The edge preserving threshold in the horizontal direction of the DEM.

Only used when estimate_k is False and a value for k is provided. Using separately-tuned thresholds for the vertical and horizontal slope directions can result in more accurate edge detection.

param.name: sigma
param.dialogReference: The input to the gaussian filter applied to the DEM when estimating k values. Specifying a sigma value bypasses the most costly step of the estimation algorithm.

param.name: estimate_each
param.dialogReference: Estimate new K values at each iteration for maximum quality smoothing. Be aware that this can impact tool runtime significantly. Each estimation uses the same sigma value.

param.name: outname
param.dialogReference: The desired path of the smoothed output raster file.

tool.summary: Smooths the input DEM using Perona-Malik anisotropic diffusion to preserve terrain feature edges.
